Our optimal candidates are familiar with the life cycle of software development (SDLC) from preliminary system review to testing and implementation.

In the end, the task of the Software Developer is to create high-quality, creative and fully-functioning software that meets coding requirements and technological design.

Technology

Floors

What does Floors do?

Floors is a constantly learning piece of technology that optimises Unified Pricing Rules in Google AdManager to create increased revenues.

The algorithm primary focus is to create the highest amount of revenue for each ad-request sent to Google AdManager. Please note that its focus is on Ad-Request eCPM and this will create some level of unfilled impressions.

These unfilled impressions need to happen, as they are the bi-product of setting the optimal floor pricing and getting the best overall returns. Yes, you can fill these unfilled impressions with a house campaign if you so wish.

What results should be expected?

Most publishers see between a 30 to 50% revenue increase over an extended period of time. When Floors is first put to work on new inventory this percentage will likely be higher for a period of time, until the dynamic buyers DSP/buying platform technologies get accustomed to the new norm of the inventory pricing.

There are no underhand bidding practices happening inside of Floors, the magic is managing & testing millions of pricing combinations at scale. Floors optimises across website, ad-unit, ad-size, geo, device, day and hour to ensure the right pricing is applied.

Bidder

Bidder is specifically designed to take advantage of a number of key technologies that publishers and networks depend on.

With Bidderâ€™s powerful tools, our clients can take advantage of the new standard in open-source technology for all of their header bidding purposes. Itâ€™s time to ensure that your website and digital strategy remains evergreen for as long as possible.

Built On Latest PreBid Technologies

You can use Bidder to create a completely customised PreBid build using as many adapters that you need to make the process easier, faster, and more streamlined than ever before. Bidder has several other features to further enhance your technology stack.

Google Ad Manager Integration

Use Bidder to leverage the true power of Ad Managerâ€™s full suite of API tools. From ad unit codes, to paths and sizes, you can pull all of this data directly from Ad Manager for a fast and seamless process that reduces manual input and mitigates risk for errors.

Prebid Server

Speed is the new currency. This is why we work with Prebid, an open source solution, providing speed and scale to any demand partner that wants to work with us. Itâ€™s a server-to-server solution that works seamlessly with other demand sources.

We do the heavy lifting, so you get fast, seamless auctions at scale. In summary, we provide super fast end-to-end header bidding software capable of handling diverse bid types and levels of latency between bidder servers and the auctioneer server for large numbers of bids.

We are fully TCF 2.0 compliant and hosted with GCP this allows us guarantee 99.99% uptime. We can handle all multi-format ads, whether its display (Web or AMP) or Native ads including Apps and Video.

Leya

Empowering data-driven decisions

We empower publishers to compete in a competitive programmatic environment that enables them to better understand their data, enabling them to make faster and more effective decisions.

Programmatic advertising connects with multiple technologies so it can be a challenge to organise and make sense of all the data from multiple sources and to make informed decisions based on your data.

Leya is our in-house proprietary technology that collects all your advertising data into one area. Itâ€™s capable of ingesting and analysing terabytes of data from multiple technologies to give you the data you need to manage your campaigns.

Itâ€™s hosted on Googleâ€™s cloud platform thatâ€™s secure (AES256 encryption) and incredibly fast so we can guarantee 99.99% uptime.

Thereâ€™s no more shifting between different platforms or multiple tabs open from a variety of dashboards. Itâ€™s all of your data, all in one place, all in real-time.s.

We made it convenient to start using Leya, there are no long-term contracts or hoops you need to go through. We provide a pay-as-you-go, pricing model that allows you the versatility and autonomy you need without any of the difficulties.

Floors

What does Floors do?

Floors is a constantly learning piece of technology that optimises Unified Pricing Rules in Google AdManager to create increased revenues.

The algorithm primary focus is to create the highest amount of revenue for each ad-request sent to Google AdManager. Please note that its focus is on Ad-Request eCPM and this will create some level of unfilled impressions. These unfilled impressions need to happen, as they are the bi-product are setting the optimal floor pricing and getting the best overall returns. Yes, you can fill these unfilled impressions with a house campaign if you so wish.

What results should be expected?

Most publishers see between a 30 to 50% revenue increase over an extended period of time. When Floors is first put to work on new inventory this percentage will likely be higher for a period of time, until the dynamic buyers DSP/buying platform technologies get accustomed to the new norm of the inventory pricing. There are no underhand bidding practices happening inside of Floors, the magic is managing & testing millions of pricing combinations at scale. Floors optimises across website, ad-unit, ad-size, geo, device, day and hour to ensure the right pricing is applied.

Are there any exceptions on the expected results?

Yes, there are a few small fringe instances where Floors hasn't seen seen the usual large revenue uplifts. Floors works extremely well with demand which has some level of dynamic or varied pricing and good examples of this are header bidding and Google AdExchange. The reason Floors works so well here is because its constantly optimising an unknown optimal floor price for each ad-request and thats where the magic happens. So why do some cases not work as expected? The answer is fairly straight forward, if the publisher/inventory to be optimised is heavily (85%+) sold out with direct campaigns then the uplift is likely to be stunted. That doesn't mean you won't see great results, but most of the magic happens away from the direct campaigns.
